answerText: Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz[10] This author produced a "hermetic biography" of Sor Juana in his book The Traps of Faith. He wrote an essay collection which includes "The Day of the Dead," an analysis of his countrymen's fascination with death.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | Finals 1 | 4 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A lost musical treatise by her compares music to a conch shell. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author who argued that women inherently have a right to education in her Reply to Sister Dorotea.
